alert.note: Alert for Carter; Johnston; Murray (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 11:21AM CDT until July 16 at 1:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast and southern Oklahoma, including the following counties, in southeast Oklahoma, Johnston. In southern Oklahoma, Carter and Murray. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1120 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sulphur, Davis, Springer, Dougherty, Gene Autry, Turner Falls, Lake Of The Arbuckles, Milo and Hennepin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
